answers.answer: Hi,How are you?  Aside from healthy lifestyle such as regular exercise, a healthy diet may indeed be very helpful for patients with diabetes and high creatinine levels. The cause of the increased creatinine can be attributed to a variety of factors and needs to be checked by a doctor. If high creatinine level is related to kidney damage, it is recommended to avoid high protein foods, high sodium food,  and meat. Eat more of  omega3-rich foods, fruits and vegetables. A diabetic diet consists of increased supplement of whole wheat, oats and barley and cut down intake of refined flour and other sugary foods like cakes, cookies, pies and candy.  Discuss this with your doctor and it is recommended that you regularly monitor your blood sugar levels also. Take car and do keep us posted.
